A

AbstractCSPDirective - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives
The AbstractCSPDirective is the base implementation for all directive values It handles basic validation and managing incoming directive values

AbstractUnsafeDirective - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives
The AbstractUnsafeDirective is a base class for script-src and style-src that uses the 'unsafe-inline' or 'unsafe-eval' which also use the nonce and hash source values.

ContentSecurityPolicy - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.csp
A Content Security Policy defines several directives that indicate from where certain kinds of content may be loaded.
ContentSecurityPolicy() - Constructor for class tophersmith.security.headers.csp.ContentSecurityPolicy
Creates a new ContentSecurityPolicy with a PolicyLevel of CSPv2
ContentSecurityPolicy(PolicyLevel) - Constructor for class tophersmith.security.headers.csp.ContentSecurityPolicy
Create a new ContentSecurityPolicy using the given PolicyLevel
ContentSecurityPolicyHeader - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.impl
The Content-Security-Policy header is used in response headers to inform the User-Agent from where certain kinds of resources may be loaded.
ContentSecurityPolicyHeader(CSPHeaderName) - Constructor for class tophersmith.security.headers.impl.ContentSecurityPolicyHeader
Constructs a new Content-Security-Policy Header object Does not configure a CSP by default, and does not enable report-only mode, also does not reduce
ContentSecurityPolicyHeader(CSPHeaderName, boolean) - Constructor for class tophersmith.security.headers.impl.ContentSecurityPolicyHeader
Constructs a new Content-Security-Policy Header object Does not configure a CSP by default
CSPHeaderName - Enum in tophersmith.security.headers.csp
Defines the available header names for CSP Defines both the standard(violation mode) header as well as the report only header
CSPValidationReport - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.csp
The CSPValidationReport holds errors and warnings related to validation of the CSP directives.

The Strict-Transport-Security header is used in response headers inform the browser User-Agent that this site must be communicated with using HTTPS.

X

XContentTypeOptionsHeader - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.impl
The X-Content-Type-Options header is used in response headers to protect against the User Agent trying to guess at the content type of the response.
XContentTypeOptionsHeader() - Constructor for class tophersmith.security.headers.impl.XContentTypeOptionsHeader
Constructs a new X-Content-Type-Options Header object By default, sets value to nosniff
XFrameOptionsHeader - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.impl
The X-Frame-Options header is used in response headers to configure which sites may frame this response's resource.
XFrameOptionsHeader() - Constructor for class tophersmith.security.headers.impl.XFrameOptionsHeader
Constructs a new X-Frame-Options Header object By default, sets the header to SAMEORIGIN
XXSSProtectionHeader - Class in tophersmith.security.headers.impl
The X-XSS-Protection header is used in response headers to require browser User Agents to enable reflective XSS protection.
XXSSProtectionHeader() - Constructor for class tophersmith.security.headers.impl.XXSSProtectionHeader
Constructs a new X-XSS-Protection Header object By default, builds X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block which enables the protection and requires the user agent to block attacks (rather than try to filter)
